name: Britannia Edinburgh Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for the weekend while attending a wedding, the hotel rooms we found to be perfect for us, lots of wardrobe and drawer space, good decor, tea/coffe making facilities, great comfy big bed, good quality bedding, all very welcoming.
reviews.title: nice rooms, ok location, poor breakfast

reviews.text: Although it was a double room they only gave us towels for one person but it was no problem if we wanted more, we heard quite a few guests asking for more towels, bit strange that they dont just put them out in the first place.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit under staffed while we were there, one woman seemed to be doing everything at once on her own but she was lovely and couldnt do enough for everyone. Our room was next to the road/entrance and at night it was quite noisy with traffic but most rooms are higher up and are probably quieter. the shower was rubbish,attatched to the wall so couldnt move shower head and the water trickles out, when you get out your not sure if you got wet or not!
reviews.title: Not bad for a cheap break
Got Cheated
reviews.text: breakfast was £7.50 each which was ridiculous for what it was, all i had was cereal, didnt like anything else so we went out for breakfast after that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good safe location, pretty surroundings, not a far walk to centre, good bus service and nice area. Would definately recommend hotel but dont take breakfast.
reviews.title: Good location, Good value, What else do you need?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving at this hotel, the parking seemed rather chaotic and there was a strange whiff of catfood outside the hotel, a smell that pervaded the hotel when the doors were left open. However, the rooms were a reasonable size - if poorly cleaned. What is the problem with hoovering to the edge of a room? Also, why only one set of towels when you know the room's booked for double occupancy?
reviews.title: Not bad for Edinburgh, but not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At £42 a night, this was very cheap with the added bonus of free parking. We walked into Edinburgh centre - it took about 20 minutes and you can meander down Rose Street or Young Street if you want. It's also easy to get to when coming from the west and convenient for the zoo.
reviews.title: Affordable Hotel Rates, but far from Edinburgh attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed two nights in this hotel, got it for gbp49 per night, but do keep in mind that travelodge charges an additional gbp2 for credit card booking online. find this very unprofessional and annoying for guests. it's quite difficult to find this hotel, as it is located at one end of the city. so be prepared to drive around and around looking for this hotel. parking at the hotel (outdoor) is haphazard but at least its free. it will take around 30-35 of leisure walk from hotel to city center (princes street). initially we got a room at the first floor, but directly outside our window, its the roof, where its very dirty and littered with cigarette butts and rubbish. and it looks like somebody has been walking around on the roof as well. so we decided to change room as we don't feel safe, and they gave us a room at at higher floor. our window now faces the main road, where it can be quite noisy during daytime when the window is opened. decided not to change as it's been a long day for us. the first night was warm, so we decided to ask for a fan and it was given. room was bigger than normal travelodge rooms, so it's ok.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money
A nice place to stay.
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in January as we had to catch an early flight from Edinburgh next day. We didn't expect much but WOW. wonderful hotel and staff and excellent value for money. Would stay here again, certainly.

We found this hotel to be clean and comfortable. We stayed in the older part of the hotel near the river so the room was a bit bigger and the layout was different to all the other travelodges we stayed at. The staff were courteous and helpful. We spent 2 nights here and walked into Edinburgh to see the sights. The walk along the river that is adjacent to the hotel is very pleasant. The only problem we had was a couple of car alarms going off the first night we were there but I can't blame the hotel for that. We were a little worried about the parking but they have spaces under the building as well that we couldn't see on the net.
reviews.title: Thank goodness for the fan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in a few Travelodges all over the country, I was very pleased with this one. The staff were very courteous, the room was exceptionally clean and came fully equipped with a flat screen TV. The hotel also had a bar/cafe which served good value meals and the drinks were average pub prices. Parking seemed to be ample; we found a great spot right outside the door and it was free all the time of our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Travelodge

reviews.text: Location wise this hotel is good if you don't want to be in the city centre and if you have a car as many of the inner city hotels don't come with parking or you have to pay NCP prices. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Princes Street but that does include an uphill bit which can be a little tiring. It took us about 25 mins to get to the Royal Mile. The walk to and from town is fine if you have a reasonable level of fitness but after a day sightseeing we were tired out. However, many guests seemed to get taxis to town and the hotel staff seemed happy to book taxis on guest's behalf.
reviews.title: one to avoid if your not good on your feet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed staying at this hotel and the location was good for our needs. The price was excellent - £120 for two nights including a Saturday night - and it was nice to have such attentive staff as have been badly treated by Travelodge employees in the past. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Average travelodge although good location

reviews.text: spent four nights in this hotel
reviews.title: Basic but OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the reception area is modern and clean, this can not be said for the room i was in. carpet coming up in places bedding not changed during the stay, damp smell in the bathroom, bad lighting in the room, not enough storage just a few hangers no drawers.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights after booking in advance on a cheap rate. The room (number 5) was small but overlooked the river which was nice and quiet (apart from the running water!). There aren't luxuries such as a hairdryer, toiletries or biscuits, but the room was very clean, tidy and looked like it was new. There wasn't a bath and the bathroom was again small but this wasn't important to us. The bed was so comfortable, we slept so well!. We didn't use the restaurant at all as we ate out for all of our meals but there seemed to be a good choice on the menu. The location is ideal for the Haymarket Train station and is about 20 minutes walk to the main city centre (quickest route we found was via Belford Road and Queensferry Street). For us, this was a nice walk each day but it would be quite tiring if you wanted to spend the day walking around the city too. If we were in Edinburgh again, we would stay here as it was such good value for money.
reviews.title: Great place to stay on a budget

reviews.text: Booked the room for 2 nights at the saver rate. However we would have been very disappointed with our stay if we had paid full price. The building has still some work going on after what appears to have been an upgrade. Our room was clean and well laid out however our friend’s room still looked unfinished. Both rooms had only one towel in them and they had been booked for 2 people. We both had to make a trip to the desk to get more. There are 3 lifts in the building as it is built on a hill only one of these was working across out whole stay of 3 days. On our last morning the fire alarm sounded at 7.00am. There are only limited spaces for car parking. All in all we had a lovely time in Edinburgh did the dungeons which was great fun and ate some really good restaurants. I would stay here again but only at the cheaper price.
reviews.title: okay

reviews.text: good clean cheap hotel, especially if you got it on a special offer.10-15 min very pleasant walk to the west end of city,good for bars and eats.mixture of restaurants from pizza express,gourmet burger co to posh and expensive.Bus stop for the airport going home handy.Nice walk along the river by the hotel for a bit of p and q.(DEANSVILLAGE SIGNS).
reviews.title: good basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast at Browns in George street,much nicer that the canteen style place at the hotel.We also printed lots of buy one get one free vouchers to use for meals courtesy of martin lewis website to complete our budget weekend.Only one problem. Smokers used the car park until early hours one night and the noise echoed around the car park.Very loud,selfish people.
reviews.title: Very fancy Travelodge, well worth the slight inconvenience of the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Travelodge is slightly outside the main city centre and is a bit of a walk from attractions like the Royal Mile and Edinburgh Castle. However the advantage of this was that this was the only Travelodge in Edinburgh that was offering the 29 pound discount rate when we booked. The rooms are very well-appointed (you can tell this only became a Travelodge recently as the sturdy dark wood decor is a world above the usual flimsy set-up) and comfortable, and the restaurant was surprisingly good given the standard Travelodge menu. The layout of the hotel is moderately confusing and it can be easy to get lost but it proved great value for money and we'd be tempted to stay here again even at full rates. The only negative was the location relative to the main tourist districts.
reviews.title: average

aka: Travelodge Edinburgh West End Hotel Edinburgh
description: Situated on the banks of the Waters of Leith in the West end of Edinburgh City Centre, the Britannia Hotel Edinburgh has 178 bedrooms and is conveniently located within easy reach of many of the cities major attractions.
